title: Multi-Walled Carbon Nanotubes Functionalized with Cyclodipeptides Improve Seed Germination and Early Development of Solanum lycopersicum
content: The development of nanomaterials focused on plants has proven to be a watershed in agriculture, where the multi-walled carbon nanotube (MWCNTs) and cyclodipeptides (CDPs) are well studied. The use of MWCNTs-CDPs in synergy above plant has not been studied. Therefore, we analyzed the effects of MWCNTs functionalized by non-covalent method with CDPs in Solanum lycopersicum development. The MWCNTs-CDPs were characterized by Fourier transform infrared spectroscopy to confirm the union of the CDPs. In addition, we demonstrated the CDPs through the seed germination of S. lycopersicum inhibits, while functionalizing MWCNTs-CDPs counteract this inhibition and increase the germination rate.
